message.content:
cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.GT, cs.MM, cs.RO 

The paper deals with the problem of material estimation from a single color image, which is a common problem in computer vision and graphics. The paper proposes an end-to-end approach that uses deep convolutional encoder-decoder architectures and image-to-image translation techniques to estimate material properties such as specular albedo, material shininess, and foreground segmentation. The paper also proposes a novel perceptual rendering loss that mimics real-world image formation. Given these factors, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories are computer vision (cs.CV), graphics (cs.GR), and geometry (cs.GT). Additionally, the paper deals with real-time frame rates, which suggests that it could also belong to multimedia (cs.MM) and robotics (cs.RO) sub-categories.
